page.title: 05EMPLOYMENT,KIRKBY UNDERWOOD
page.content: Despite their rural location Hawthorpe and Kirkby Underwood have few people working directly in{agriculture.}There are five owner-occupied or tenant farmers and three farm workers. Three people are employed in agricultural services, a dealer in heavy plant and machinery, a farm machinery salesman and an animal food distributor. Three people earn supplementary income from selling their surplus flowers, fruit and vegetables. There are two part- time horticultural workers and a contract gardener. The group of houses known as "The Forestry" in fact includes housing for just one forestry worker employed by the local Forestry Commission. There are several people employed in {transport:}three bus drivers, two lorry drivers and one crane driver.The area also has three motor mechanics.
